name: N-{4-[(1E)-3-Oxo-3-phenylprop-1-en-1-yl]phenyl}acetamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1087
Reason: The melting point of N-{4-[(1E)-3-Oxo-3-phenylprop-1-en-1-yl]phenyl}acetamide can be estimated based on the functional groups present in the molecule. The presence of an oxo group and a phenyl group can increase the melting point by approximately +20°C each, while the tertiary butyl group (C(C)C) can add about +10°C due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume. The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) may add roughly +20°C due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact. The amide group (O=C(N1CCCC1)) includes functionalities related to amides, which can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30°C. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
